Literature Review: The resolution of inflammation is a complex process that involves the coordinated action of various pro-resolving lipid mediators and specialized pro-resolving peptide mediators. This process is crucial for the resolution of inflammation and has been implicated in the pathogenesis of various chronic diseases. In recent years, there has been a growing interest in the development of resolution pharmacology, which aims to harness the biology of the resolution of inflammation to develop innovative therapeutic strategies for the management of inflammatory conditions. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge on the biology of the resolution of inflammation, with a focus on pro-resolving annexin A1 and lipid mediators, and to discuss the potential of resolution pharmacology for therapeutic innovation in inflammation.
